medical_history.chief_complaint: Persistent fetal bradycardia observed during scheduled prenatal check-up.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient's symptoms began during her first pregnancy with fetal bradycardia detected at 36 weeks of gestation, leading to premature delivery. In her second pregnancy, she was referred at 31 weeks and again at 34 weeks of gestation due to persistent fetal bradycardia.
medical_history.past_medical_history: The patient has a history of multiple syncopal attacks and a previous pregnancy with diagnosed Romano-Ward Syndrome in her neonate, confirmed by prolonged QT intervals in both mother and child.
medical_history.family_history: Molecular genetic testing in the mother and her offspring revealed identical mutations within the LQT1 locus, indicating a familial connection to the Long-QT Syndrome.
